active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between standardized NIST notification formats and organization-specific custom templates. Consider scenarios like rapid phishing vs. prolonged OT disruptions: Which format ensures faster coordination without sacrificing detail? Support arguments with NIST SP 800-61 examples.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Incident Notification Formats (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Team Organization > 005_Communication and Coordination > Information Sharing > Incident Notification Formats). **Core Content Summary (Web-Grounded Research):** Incident notifications inform stakeholders of cybersecurity events for coordinated response (NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 2/3). Key elements: Incident ID, Date/Time, Reporter, Description, Severity (e.g., High/Critical), Affected Assets, Impact, Actions Taken, Next Steps. Templates from NIST SP 800-61 (p. 3-17 to 3-20); integrate with CSF 2.0 (RS.CO-2). OT specifics (NISTIR 7621/8428): Prioritize safety, delayed notifications. Legal: CISA 72-hr reporting. Sources: NIST SP 800-61r2 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-61r2.pdf), SP 800-61r3 draft (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3/final), CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework), NISTIR 8428 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2022/NIST.IR.8428.pdf), NISTIR 7621 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/irstds/NIST.IR.7621r1.pdf). **Pedagogy Integration:** Generate 50 flashcards progressing through Bloom's levels and 4 scaffolding layers. Use provided objectives, active learning, and schema. Ensure university-style: active recall, spaced repetition friendly. **Generation Rules:** - 40% Remember/Understand (Layers 1-2). - 30% Apply/Analyze (Layer 3). - 30% Evaluate/Create (Layer 4). - Follow exact flashcard schema: Multiple choice/cloze on front; structured back with explanation, tags. - Distractors per protocol. - Tie to active learning (e.g., 'Apply in problem-solving exercise'). **Output Format (JSON Array):** [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...', 'source': '...'}}, ...] Generate now.
